other_tests.findings: Findings consistent with cholecystitis (GB wall thickening, 4mm, gallstones, negative ___, no pericholecystic fluid)

Small left pleural effusion with overlying atelectasis. Patchy left base retrocardiac opacity may relate to effusion and atelectasis, although consolidation cannot be excluded. A trace right effusion may also be present. Focal areas of linear atelectases/scarring particularly in the mid lungs bilaterally.
